Question_1.Context: The study focuses on the elastic-plastic deformation of functionally graded material hollow rotor under high centrifugal effect. The results are compared with a homogeneous rotor and a case where Young’s modulus is the only variable.
Question_1.Question: What is the purpose of the study?
Question_1.A: To investigate the stress components in FGM rotors
Question_1.B: To determine the maximum allowed angular velocity of a hollow functionally graded material rotating shaft
Question_1.C: To analyze the thermal behavior of FGM materials
Question_1.D: To study the chemical properties of functionally graded materials
Question_1.Source: The purpose of this study is to present an analytical solution of the elastic-plastic deformation of functionally graded material hollow rotor under a high centrifugal effect and finally determine the maximum allowed angular velocity of a hollow functionally graded material rotating shaft.

Question_2.Context: The study discusses the effects of variable material properties on the stress and strain components and radial displacement of functionally graded material rotors.
Question_2.Question: What effect does material variation have on stress and strain components?
Question_2.Source: It is shown that material variation has a considerable effect on the stress and strain components and radial displacement.

Question_3.Context: The study introduces non-dimensional parameters to solve the equilibrium equation analytically.
Question_3.Question: What method is used to solve the equilibrium equation?
Question_3.Source: Introducing non-dimensional parameters, the equilibrium equation has been analytically solved.

Question_4.Context: The study discusses the effects of density on the failure of a functionally graded material elastic fully plastic in a hollow rotating shaft.
Question_4.Question: What is investigated for the first time in this study with regard to Tresca’s yield criterial?
Question_4.Source: The effects of the density on the failure of a functionally graded material elastic fully plastic in a hollow rotating shaft are investigated for the first time in this study with regard to Tresca’s yield criterial.

Question_5.Context: The study discusses the analytical solution for the elastic-plastic deformation of functionally graded material hollow rotor under high centrifugal effect.
Question_5.Question: What is the criterion used to determine the yield condition and allowed angular velocity of the shaft?
Question_5.Source: Tresca’s criterion is considered to determine yield condition and allowed the angular velocity of the shaft.

Question_6.Context: The study validates the model for plastic deformations by comparing results with previous articles.
Question_6.Question: What is the significance of considering variable density and yield stress in the study?
Question_6.A: It causes a considerable difference in stress and strain
Question_6.B: It has no effect on the results
Question_6.D: It increases the complexity of the model
Question_6.Source: The results show that neglecting the variety of density and yield stress causes a considerable difference in stress and strain.

Question_7.Context: The study presents an analytical model based on different studies and non-dimensional parameters.
Question_7.Question: What is the main improvement of the analytical model presented in the study?
Question_7.B: It considers only one variable property of the material
Question_7.D: It includes multiple variable material properties
Question_7.Source: The analytical equations derived based on different studies, and non-dimensional parameters defined to create comprehensive and analogical outcomes.

Question_8.Context: The study discusses the effects of neglecting the variety of density and yield stress in the analysis.
Question_8.Question: What is the potential consequence of neglecting the variety of density and yield stress?
Question_8.B: Considerable difference in stress and strain
Question_8.Source: The results show that neglecting the variety of density and yield stress causes a considerable difference in stress and strain.

Question_9.Context: The study discusses the elastic-plastic behavior of a rotating shaft made of FGM under high centrifugal forces.
Question_9.Question: What is the importance of the research findings for gas turbine design industries?
Question_9.A: No relevance to gas turbine design
Question_9.B: Helps control the yield start point for hollow shafts during maintenance
Question_9.C: Increases the complexity of turbine design
Question_9.D: Has no practical application in industry
Question_9.Source: This model will help to control the yield start point for a hollow shaft measured during maintenance.

Question_10.Context: The study concludes by discussing the implications of the research findings for the design of high-speed rotary components.
Question_10.Question: What is the potential application of the results for designers of high-speed rotary components?
Question_10.B: Provides a better understanding of possible weaknesses in hollow shafts
Question_10.Source: The results will help designers to get a better perception of hollow shafts possible weaknesses and failures to design more efficient rotary machines.
